text: (upbeat music)
- [Host] Welcome to BBQPitBoys.com.

Today we're smokin' up
some Pork Belly Bites
at the pit and it's real easy to do.

All right this is pork belly
if you never seen it before

and this is what they
make bacon out of, right?

You can see that they make
thin slices out of it.

All right but we're
makin' Pork Belly Bites.
Ah, you gotta definitely check this out
if you never had them before.

And we're cuttin' this pork
belly up into smaller pieces

so we can easily remove
the pork skin on it.

You don't want the skin, you
just want the layer of fat
and meat underneath.

And here we're cuttin' the
pork belly up into bite-size

bits right maybe um
maybe one to two inches,
whatever you consider bite-size.
Here we're puttin' on some olive oil.
Hey man, this is going to be good.
(upbeat music)

Here we're adding some rubbing,
use your favorite rub course

we're going to use ours and
we're gonna load it up good.
Oh yeah!

This looks good enough to
eat already. (chuckling)

Now you could do this
a few hours beforehand

or maybe overnight, it's
up to you, but we're
going straight to our Colossus Smoker.

And we got the smoker set at
about 250 degrees Fahrenheit

because we're doing some low
and slow, we want to really

tenderize this pork
belly thing. All right.
(upbeat music)
Oh yeah.
Nothin' do now, kick back, and wait.
(upbeat music)

All right, these bites have
been on this smoker now for

a little over two hours, right,
and now we're gonna make 'em

The Pit Boys' Pork Belly
Bites you gotta check this out

we're addin' eh, maybe a quarter
pound of butter in there.

(chuckle) It's up to you.
We're also adding some honey.
And the idea here is to make 'em candy,

make 'em sweet, tender,
maybe a little bit of heat.

We're addin' a couple bottles
of our barbecue sauce.

Use your sauce, we've
got some hot sauce there

kickin' up a bit, you set
this up the way you want it.
Here of course, we're addin' some whiskey.
(rock music)
Mix it good.
Give it a good mix, oh yeah.
(rock music)
You gettin' hungry or what?

We got some beans goin' on
here and we're gonna show you
what we're gonna do with those.

Now we're, uh, wrappin'
it in some aluminum foil

throw it back on the
smoker, and we'll go for

maybe another hour or so and
this is gonna help tenderize
those Pork Belly Bites.
(rock music)
Oh yeah, chicken too.
(rock music)
Oh boy!

About an hour has gone by,
more or less, now we're gonna
pull the aluminum foil off.

Mix the beans. Ooo wee!
Now, we go for another hour.
More or less.
(trumpet music)

And in the miracle of time,
'cause you've got no time
to waste now do we?

We're going to um,
we're going to ladle off
some of the access liquid.
You may or may not have to do this
but that'll help it get really candied.
(relaxing music)

I say it's uh, time to
eat, take a look at that.

Now, we're gonna add these
to our homemade beans
and we'll give you a link to those beans
in the description below, all right?
But uh, we're usin' our Pork Belly Bites

in our homemade beans today,
you can tell the chickens are
lookin' forward to that. (chuckle)
(upbeat music)
Lord have mercy.
I say it's time to eat.
(BBQ Pit Boys music)

Now of course you can eat
these Pork Belly Bites as

hors d'oevres. Roll 'em
in the beans like this.
They're excellent in the beans.
You definitely have to check this out.
(BBQ Pit Boys music)

And we do apologize for eatin'
in front of you like this
but we call this Pit Master Crib.
(BBQ Pit Boys music)

So the next time you're
lookin' for an easy barbeque
